overview: Ten years ago, the famous Russian actor Konstantin Khabensky organized children's development studios in several cities of Russia. A feature of such studios was complete freedom of expression for children and improvisation instead of staging standard plays. In the studio, everyone has the right to invention and protest - this is how children heal emotional wounds, probe the adult world, and, on the stage, fantastic performances appear on the stage. Every year, young talents gather in one of the cities for the Feathers festival, where Konstantin Yuryevich works with them. The guys show everything they learned and do it to the fullest
title: Plumage
